title: queen gave kate middleton secret
story: Queen gave Kate Middleton secret princess lessons before she married Prince WilliamThe Queen is believed to have given Kate Middleton secret lessons on how to act as a royal before she married Prince William, like how to preserve her modesty, according to a royal journalistKate Middleton and the Queen Image: PAByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience WriterDan Wiggins:,  Feb |commentsMarrying into the royal family must be incredibly daunting with all the expectations, responsibility and endless rules to abide by.The then Kate Middleton had a lot to learn in the run up to her  wedding to Prince William as she didnapost come from a royal or high society background. But luckily the Queen was there to teach her everything she knows, reports MyLondon.According to the  Amazon Prime documentary, Kate Middleton: Working Class to Windsor, Kate took private lessons on “how to be a royal we” before the big day - and who better to learn how to be a royal from than the head of the family herself. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .The meetings between the two reportedly happened ahead of Kateaposs wedding. During this time, the Queen also helped Kate decide what her official royal title could be, eventually settling on Catherine, Her Royal Highness The Duchess of Cambridge. From the beginning, Kate Middleton had a great deal of support from the Royal Family which was really instructed by the Queen, Journalist Ashley Pearson explained in the documentary.This was to make sure she knew as much as she could possibly know and what to do in every situation – bearing in mind, of course, that she didn’t grow up in this world. As for what Kateaposs secret aposPrincess lessonsapos involved, Ashley revealed the one thing that she really needed to work on was how to apospreserve her modesty.apos Ashley continued: There were things like learning how to get out of a carriage without exposing your modesty and learning how to bend down to get flowers from a young girl without exposing your modesty.Things that you would never think you’d have to learn but, of course, a woman in her position would certainly need to know. There were all kinds of small details and little bits of etiquette – how to sit, who to curtsy to, who not to curtsy to, what fork to use and whatever  they felt she needed to know. She was actually given lessons on how to be a royal we. Kateaposs mother-in-law Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, also has some words of wisdom on how to aposhang on to a prince.apos But according to royal author Robert Lacey, she struggled to follow it. Camillaaposs essential tip for Kate was to make sure her le moulded to the way William leads his, in order to make the union last. In his royal biography, Battle of Brothers, Robert said: Camilla had confided to Kate the secret of hanging on to a busy prince: fit your timetable - well, basically your whole le - around his. However, despite Camillaaposs advice, Lacey claims that this wasnapost really possible for Kate as Williamaposs diary was un-fit-roundable.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: queen sends staff secret signals
story: Queen sends staff secret signals with her handbag - and twist of wedding ring is bad newsThe Queen uses her handbag, and sometimes her jewellery, to signal to royal staff that she wants to leave an event, that she is in danger or that shes finished talking to somebodyThe Queen has secret signals for staff Image: Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Feb |commentsThe Queen is rarely seen without a handbag and there has been much fascination over the years about what she carries in it. Insiders have claimed lipstick, a mirror, sweeteners for her tea, mints and a fountain pen are some the essentials she fits the timeless accessory. Sheaposs known to keep her favourite bags for decades and her go-to make is Launer London handbags, of which she is said to own more than  of. And these beautul bags serve a bigger purpose than you might think.T he Queen uses the accessory to secretly let staff she is not happy without having to say a word.According to The ,Her Majesty wants to end dinner in five minutes time, all she has to do is pop her bag on the table. She also tends to drape her handbag over her left arm, soshe switches it, itaposs a clear sign she wants to move along, according to royal historian Hugo Vicker. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .This discrete cue will encourage staff to end the conversation.He told People : It would be very worryingyou were talking to the Queen and saw the handbag move from one hand to the other.However, she will be so subtle about it that you may not even realise itaposs happened. Staff will then usher them away or will tell them that the Queen is needed for something . Mr Vicker said: It would be done very nicely. Someone would come along and say, ‘Sir, the Archbishop of Canterbury would very much like to meet you.apos Butshe ever puts her bag down on the floor, be worried, as this means she needs to be saved from an encounter as soon as possible. If for some reason she doesnapost have her handbag with her or is unable to communicate using it, sheaposll send messages using her jewellery. A discreet twist of her wedding ring means she would like to end a conversation quickly, but a more dramatic spin means she wishes to make a quick getaway.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news uk-news rare-snap-inside-prince-annes-"Princess Anne set a new trend with her micro weddingByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsEver wondered what itaposs like to live the lavish le of a royal  Well now, you can see for yourself... Princess Anne gave a rare insight into her home in a post on social media, and itaposs not quite what you might expect.The -year-old royal lives in Gatcombe Park, a -acre estate out in the Gloucestershire countryside, with her husband Sir Timothy Laurence.This residence is purely a private home, but the grounds are occasionally opened up for horse trials as Princess Anne and her daughter Zara Tindall are both highly skilled former Olympic equestrians. In a picture shared on the official Royal Family Twitter account, Princess Anne was seen watching Scotland play England in the Rugby Six Nations tournament with her husband.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . It wascaptioned: As Scotland team patron, The Princess Royal often supports the team from the stands.Her Royal Highness and Vice Admiral Sir Tim cheered Scotland on from home today as they played England for the Calcutta Cup,  years since their first match. Well played, Scotland. Scotland beat England - during the opening weekend of the annual tournament. The pair looked quite relaxed watching the game in her cosy living room, which was filled with family photographs, paintings, books and ious trinkets.  Pictures of Princess Zaraaposs  christening as well as photos of her son Peter Phillips as a youngster could be seen around the room, as could numerous books including two large copies of animals. On the walls were several landscape paintings in mismatched frames, all of which appeared to be of ious seaside towns. Two cabinets on the back wall were filled with little ornaments, like porcelain animal figurines, and more framed photos.Many royal fans offered their opinions on the room, as one person said: Thank you HRH but please declutter, that would play havoc with my OCD. Another said: I feel a little claustrophobic just looking at all the stuff in their living room.In a video congratulating those who were involved in the opening of the NHS Louisa Jordan Hospital in Glasgow, we got to see another room in the home.The cream-coloured room features metallic bronze furniture including a large mirror, a cabinet filled with animal ornaments, and four rectangular framed photos hanging on the walls. There are also three side tables behind her - one features a blue and white desk lamp with a large lampshade and three framed photos.  Another below the mirror holds more photo frames and a vase full of light pink roses, and the last directly behind Anne showcases two white photo frames including a photo of Zara and her husband Mike on their wedding day. Zara also lives on the Gatcombe Park estate with Mike along with their daughters Mia, six, and Lena, one. We got to see a small glimpse inside of their home when she appeared as a guest on Good Morning Britain via video call.  Zara sang the Queenaposs praises to Piers Morgan on the national address on coronavirus she delivered to the UK, and also thanked the NHS and key workers for their hard work.The video call meant viewers were able to see into her home, as the shot showed a cream room with traditional wooden beams and a staircase in the corner. It also showed a cream kettle and a coffee maker on the side, and a Dyson fan.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: schools letter home after storm
story: Schools letter home after Storm Franklin made mum feel like a bad parentAll Saints Catholic Primary School in Merseyside sent a letter criticising parents who kept their kids home and sayingchildren in war-torn nations could "clamber over rubble past bombed out ruins" why their kids could not come to classesParents of children at All Saints Catholic Primary School in Bootle received a letter on Monday Image: Liverpool ECHOByAbigail NicholsonKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A school’s “disgusting letter” to parents after Storm Franklin left one mum ‘feeling like a bad parent’. Parents at All Saints Catholic Primary School, in Bootle, Merseyside, received a letter on Monday after the storm battered Britain, bringing winds of up to mph.This was the third storm to hit the country within a week.In the letter, it explained that the school was ‘staggered’ due to the absences of “many children” The Liverpool Echo reported.One mum slammed the letter and school’s behaviour, calling it “disgusting”. For safety reasons I didn’t want him walking on his own, there were many people who I’m aware have kept their kids off too.  When I saw the email from the school I was crying to my sister about it because they were making me feel like a bad parent for putting my kid first. The letter read: Welcome back to a new half term to all who ed to school this morning. It was lovely to see our children excitedly reunite with their friends and with staff. Unfortunately, we have many children absent today, not because of Covid or other illnesses but apparently because of the wind! I have to say I find this staggering, not least because most live in very close proximity to school.  Given the amount of pre-school and school experiences that our children have already missed in the last two years, missing a whole dayaposs learning today is unacceptable. For staff, many of whom travelled considerable distances here this morning, eager to introduce new learning topics to their class, it is incredibly frustrating. The apostone deafapos letter went on to speak about how they were in awe when seeing photographs of children walking barefoot to school for miles or clambering over rubble past bombed out ruins in war-torn countries. It said: Iaposm always in awe when I see photographs of children and parents around the world who value education so dearly that they walk barefoot for miles or clamber over rubble, past bombed out ruins, in order to get to school. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  I wonder what they might make of our attendance rates in school today. The mum, who asked to remain anonymous, said: I’ve kept my son off school due to the winds as I work from am being a single mum he has to take himself to school. For safety reasons I didn’t want him walking on his own, there were many people who I’m aware have kept their kids off too. When I saw the email from the school I was crying to my sister about it because they were making me feel like a bad parent for putting my kid first. I was shocked at the last bit of the email, thereaposs no comparing kids here and people in really poor countries. It was awful.  All Saints Headteacher Angela Holleran said she regrets any upset caused to parents and explained it wasnapost our intention.She said: We are aware that we did experience windy conditions on Monday morning and that the Met Office had issued a yellow weather warning for our area, indicating possible low-level impact.In line with schools across Sefton, we were open as normal to all pupils. All risk assessments on the site had been completed well in advance of the children arriving. “All of our staff were in school ready for the start of the new half term, fully expecting pupils to arrive, given that the overwhelming majority live in very close proximity to the school.  For pupils who did attend, classes went ahead as normal and following a further risk assessment, children were able to play and learn outdoors. We regret any upset caused to the parent who felt the need to contact the Liverpool Echo. This was not our intention. “Pre and post -Covid, our focus was and remains, on the entitlement of every child to a full-time education. Governors and staff at All Saints are mindful of the well-established link between school attendance and a happy and successful le. The disruption to childrenaposs learning and development, as a result of the pandemic, is signicant and far- reaching in all year groups. In response, from September , we extended the school day at both ends to provide additional teaching time to all children. Comprehensive tutoring and pastoral programmes have also been implemented across the school to support children. We want all children to be in school every day to benefit from as much of this support as possible and we hope parents will work with us to ensure this is the case. title: family seven convert 120 year
story: Family-of-seven convert -year-old church into home with pew seats and font for sinkMatt and Kristen Gray from Ohio, US, spent five months turning a local church dating back to  into a family home for their family of sevenMatt and Kristen Gray with their children outside the church - their home Image: Matt and Kristen Gray   SWNSByFiona Jackson:,  Feb |commentsA family-of-seven have converted a  church into their home – and use the pews as seats at the dining room table and font as the kitchen sink Parents Matt and Kristen Gray,  and , were looking to move somewhere close by where their children wouldn’t have to cross busy roads to get to their school. The couple set their sights on the local church when they heard it would be moving and after several years of waiting, they finally purchased it for , in December . They proceeded to spend five months turning it into a family home, painting the exterior completely black and building four bedrooms, three full bathrooms and three half-bathrooms. They also created two offices, a workout room, lobby, craft room, game room, two laundry rooms and two TV rooms.  Kristen said the best thing about living in a church was “absolutely everything”. She added: The slide is a huge one...the kids laugh every time they go down! We’ve never had a house where all seven of us can cook in the kitchen together but here we can and we love that so much. Matt said the pair had “always loved” historic restoration and reuse. “We love the cosy, Scandinavian feel of black,” he said.  In , the family wanted to move away from their property in Troy, Ohio, US, and closer to their children’s school in Pleasant Hill, so they wouldn’t have to cross as many busy roads to get there. Matt said: “We heard through the rumour mill that the church had land south of town and was looking to build a new facility. My wonderfully creative, yet slightly too creative we, Kristen came up with this idea that was crazy at the time, yet the idea grew legs.” Within just two weeks they approached the church with the idea of purchasing the building, and after a few weeks of discussions, their offer was sadly rejected as it wasnapost the right time.In their excitement, Matt and Kristen had already accepted an offer their family home, so moved into a ‘doer-upper’ they bought at auction. “We thought about it every day since we first walked through it,” said Kristen. Four years and two house flips later, Pleasant Hill Church of God reached out to the Grays once more and said they had begun construction on their new facility and were ready to sell. Matt said: “I think they really appreciated the idea and the fact that the building would now house a new purpose and would not be torn down to create a parking lot as previously proposed.  “In a way that only God himself could orchestrate, the timing and financial positioning of all of the above happened in a fully coordinated and perfectly timed way.” Using the money they had made through increasing the equity on their previous two homes, they closed on the church for , in November , and a month later it held its final service. Decorating started as soon as Matt and Kristen had got the green light from the village community. They gave it a new metal roof and upgraded the plumbing and electrics, before painting the exterior black. Matt said: “The black theme is complemented and softened with copper accents, gas flame lanterns, natural limestone and tactfully designed landscaping.”  They also wanted to involve their five children, between the ages of eight and , to design their bedrooms and other spaces like a craft room, game room, TV room and reading nooks. They also created a home-schooling area, as their two sons and three daughters are now taught by Kristen. The parents also added a huge master bedroom with a soaking bath, walk-in shower, office spaces, gym area and laundry facilities. As well as these modern features, Matt and Kristen were also able to keep a few of the original items from the church to use in their design. The pews now act as seating in the dining and home-schooling rooms, and the font used for baptisms has been repurposed as their kitchen sink.  Commercial contractor Matt said: To think of all the lives that were transformed in this steel tub gives you goosebumps. “Now it is living a bit less glamorous le as our kitchen sink, regardless we are excited that it could be salvaged and used. A church attendance board, which once displayed numbers in the hundreds, is now in the bell tower with a count of seven. They all lived inside the church while renovations took place, and for the first month, they didn’t have a working shower or bath. Dad Matt said: “We would have to schedule showers at area family and friends’ houses. “Meanwhile, you better have hit the restroom before going to bed, asyou woke up in the middle of the night needing to pee you would have to travel across a dark and spooky -year-old church to find the nearest restroom! After five months the conversion was complete, but the family still like the building to be used by the community for bible study and as a food bank. Matt said: “This small town has a huge heart full of amazing people, we simply try to hold up our end of that bargain and do things the right way. “We love having a place that is fun, safe and conveniently located. “We can spread out and have our separate spaces, yet are close to each other. It truly feels like home.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Pleasant HillArtHoly Churchproperty news" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterSubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum leaves clinic brand new
story: Mum leaves clinic with brand new body after £, breast reduction goes wrongWARNING: GRAPHIC IMAGES Tfany Mills claims the accidental procedure was passed off as bonus surgery by staff at the hospital after her records were mixed up with another patientsTfany Mills says she woke up from surgery in the worst pain of her le Image: Kennedy News Selena FarrByAlice PeacockSamantha Mordi:,  Feb |commentsA mum who went for breast reduction surgery got more than she bargained for after leaving with breast implants, tummy tuck and liposuction by mistake. Tfany Mills, from Tampa, Florida, claims the accidental procedure was passed off as aposbonusapos surgery by staff at a clinic on the West Coast of the US after her records were mixed up with another patients. She visited the clinic last year to have her F breasts reduced on November , after years of suffering from back pain due to their size. When the mum-of-three woke up from her surgery she said she was left in the worst pain of her le. Tfany, a nurse said I woke up in the absolute worst pain of my le. I didnapost qualy for the abdominal surgery as I had no extra skin to pull.  Theyaposd pulled my skin too tight, meaning I had a lot of scar tissue and wasnapost able to stand up straight. My belly button looked like a coin slot because Iaposd been pulled as tight as possible. The incisions under my breasts ripped completely open because of the fact that they added implants, it was too much weight. It was the worst experience of my entire le. She was then rushed to hospital after the implants tore open her skin leaving her with oozing, open wounds and blood clots in her lungs and legs, with doctors worried she would go into septic shock.It was only the day after the surgery that the clinic admitted they had accidentally preformed the wrong surgery. She said:I trusted that I was only having my breasts done. From working in the medical field I know they would only mark where theyaposre performing procedures. I was so confused how there was a mix-up. They told me the whole team made a mistake - they werenapost maintaining surgical logs, they werenapost checking their patients.They had no idea what they were performing or who on. They did this without my consent, I had no idea this was going on Two weeks later, Tfany was admitted to hospital after the wounds beneath her breast became infected and blood clots were found in her lungs and legs. She was left fearing for her le as doctors worried that she would go into septic shock.I was terried, because I have three children, and I was scared I wasnapost going to be there for them,” Tfany said. I was absolutely furious at the fact the clinic was so careless. I was in the hospital for four days and then sought wound care for two months. I was probably on about five dferent antibiotics before the infections cleared up. Tfany has been struggling to get her le back to normal since the procedure, as she dealt with the financial fallout of being unable to work following the ordeal.  I managed to dispute the surgery charge with my bank and get the money back. The clinic is trying to fight it and claiming that this is what I asked for,” she said. She had just had another surgery to correct part of the problem the doctors caused, and said her ex-husband and her vet assistant partner Kris Harper were helping out where they could, with things like childcare. She was still recovering, Tfany said, from a second surgery to fix part of the problem caused, and had been asked to consider scar revision treatment for the marks left under her breasts. The clinic did not respond to a request for comment. title: woman same name suspect spends
story: Woman with same name as suspect spends  days in jail in case of mistaken identityPolice swooped to stop Bethany K. Farber boarding a plane to Mexico and took her into custody for almost two weeks but her family came forward to prove it was a big case of mistaken identityBethany K. Farber says she suffered “severe stress, anxiety and mental anguish” due to her arrest Image: nypostBySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Feb |comments A furious woman is suing the police after being forced to spend two weeks in custody just for having the same name as the suspect they were hunting.Bethany K. Farber, , was stopped as she tried to join her family in Mexico last April.She told officers she was not the person they were looking for and had never been to Texas, US, where the alleged crime they were investigating took place.The LAPD proceeded to arrest her in front of airport staff without confirming her identity or checking her driver’s licence, legal documents state. Despite her pleas, she was handcuffed to a chair at Los Angeles International Airport before being forced to spend  days behind bars.Have your say on this story in the comment section She described conditions as dangerous and terrying - and also says she felt defeated before her family finally proved she was at her auntaposs house on the day in question after finding a photo. A federal lawsuit alleges “LAPD held [Farber] in jail for the next  days until April , . She told FOX: I told them you have the wrong person - please check. They ignored me and then handcuffed me to a chair in the airport.The woman, from Calornia, US, was held without bail for almost a fortnight. Now she says she is seeking compensation and doesnapost want any other “law-abiding” citizens to go through what she did. “You know this is why we have our constitutional amendments in place to protect us,” she said in a statement. “We shouldn’t be fearing law enforcement. “It could happen to anyone.  The filing reads: “Plaintf is a young woman with long, blonde hair, while the other woman is older with short brown hair. “Furthermore, the warrant was for a woman in the State of Texas and Plaintf has never been to the State of Texas.” Her lawyer Rodney Biggs feels the fact that the woman was trying to board a plane saw her treated as a flight risk. “The fact no one checked her middle name, her birth date,” Biggs said. “No information representing her person - they didn’t even check basic information that Bethany was not the other Bethany Farber.”The LAPD say they do not comment on pending litigation, a department spokesman told the Los Angeles Times.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON PoliceCourt caseCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: im embarrassed what dad named
story: Im so embarrassed by what my dad named our dog - walks in the park are very awkwardThe dog owner asked her dad for help with naming her dog - but now regrets it because she is tired of having to explain her dachshunds weird name to strangersHer dad named her dog Bag, which translates to Tasche in GermanByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Feb |commentsPicking out a dogaposs name isnapost always easy as there are so many options to choose from. While some turn to their favourite books, television shows and movies for inspiration, others seek advice from their close friends and family.But one dog owner regrets turning to her dad for help as her dachshundaposs name is constantly being misunderstood by strangers in the street. Sharing her embarrassment on Reddit, the owner explained how her dad named her dog Bag, which translates to Tasche in German.to ourTeamDogs newsletterfor your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories. The woman can often be heard shouting for her dog in parks when trying to gain her attention, leaving other owners to question the unusual name. She said: Itaposs a funny name for a dog in general but I hate it when people want to know her name from curiosity. Itaposs just awkward for me, especially when they misunderstand her name and I have to repeat it. Wanting to avoid this awkward encounter in the future, the owner is pleading with people to refrain from questioning a dogaposs name when itaposs something they havenapost heard before. If you want to know, for example, the name of the dog of a pedestrian, and itaposs weird, donapost question it, she added.  Hoping to reassure the owner, one person said: You shouldnapost be ashamed of your dogaposs unique name. I doubt that she minds her name. I would suggest not reading too much into peopleaposs curiosity. We named our dog Chipotle after the restaurant. Itaposs an inside joke of my favourite place to eat when I met my we. Most people want to know why, and this gives me an opportunity to have a nice conversation with a stranger. View it as a positive. While another added: If theyaposre strangers you could just ignore them and pretend you donapost hear or understand. If people misunderstand the name that feels normal, buttheyaposre questioning or judging it thataposs not cool and I would just ignore them. Or you could make up a funny story like aposwell sheaposs so ugly that usually we make her wear a bag over her headapos or something ridiculous that freaks people out even more than the name. Sharing their own unusual dog names, one user said: I rarely tell people my dogaposs full name, Finlaggan, because I don’t want questions. The name has deeper meaning to me, but basically sheaposs named after a boat. Another added: My boyfriend has two cats - Gato and Girlfriend. Weird animal names are fun. People always think the name Girlfriend is weird, but he named her that because one day Gato, who used to be a stray, came home with her - and so it was like she was his girlfriend. Does your dog have an unusual name  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. news weird-news i-pregnant-two-weeks-after-"TikTok user reveals she got pregnant two weeks postpartumByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments A young mum has revealed she canapost wait to have her body back after spending almost two years straight pregnant.Gracie, from the US, is due to give birth to her second child in just a few weeks, meaning sheaposll have two babies aged just nine months apart, as she fell pregnant again just two weeks after giving birth.The -year-old recently took to TikTok to share a photo of her baby bump, while hitting back at cruel trolls who implied she was too young to have two babies.Iaposve been pregnant for almost two years straight and Iaposm ready to give birth to this baby and have my body back, she said in the clip.Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here. Posted from her handle @graciee, the mum continued: Yes itaposs most healthy to wait for your body to heal. If I could go back in know what I know now I would have waited. No I donapost think itaposs a flex.Gracie went on to say she couldnapost care less what anyone thinks of her and her partner becoming parents while teenagers, adding: He is an amazing father and we have always wanted two kids. Many TikTok users rushed to the comments section to question why she and her partner didnapost wait the standard six weeks between giving birth and having intercourse, but Gracie said they werenapost educated as the doctor told them they could do it when they felt ready. I didn’t want to wait clearly that’s why I did it butI could go back knowing the risks that were involved I would have lmao - how are you confused  Gracie responded to one follower. After this child we do not plan on having another baby until + years I am getting a IUD. My baby is beyond taken care of and this one will be too. We have our own home, own cars, own bank accounts. We are grown. Our families are  per cent involved in our childrenaposs le but they ABSOLUTELY do not raise our babies. He works a full-time job and I’m a stay at home. As long as both mum and baby are happy and healthy, thataposs all that matters. Congratulations, mamma.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: i regret having three kids
story: I regret having three kids - I wish I couldve done something more with my leA mum-of-three has said shes been left questioning everything, after giving birth to a third child made her feel like shes "thrown her le away" by having kids at such a young ageThe mum feels like shes thrown her own le away Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Feb |commentsA mum-of-three has revealed she frequently wishes she never had any kids at all, confessing sheaposd thrown her le away at such a young age.The mum claims she didnapost actually want kids when she was younger, but by the time she was  sheaposd given birth to her first child, with her second coming along when she was .I have three kids and quite frequently wish I had none. I never wanted kids and knew I wanted more from my le than dirty diapers and minivans, she vented on Reddit. I was okay with the first two but the third really made me question everything again.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. The mum, who had her youngest child when she was , says simply raising kids is not what she wants to be doing and now fears sheaposs lost the chance to ever do anything . This is not what I want to be doing with my le. I had my kids at such a young age that I donapost stand a chance at doing anything signicant with my le other than saying, aposhey I raised  more humans.apos Youaposre welcome. What an accomplishment, she wrote. However, the mum was quickly inundated with supportive comments pointing out that by having kids so young it means sheaposll still be young enough to do things once all her children are adults. Your kids will all be grown by the time youaposre . That is amazing, one Reddit user commented, adding: There will be plenty of time in your le to do whatever you want and youaposll still be young enough to do it. Another agreed: Youaposll be young when your kids are out of the house. You have your whole le ahead of you, while a third added: It is possible to do signicant things with your le even when certain obstacles come your way.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: job ad slammed bonkers huge
story: Job ad slammed as bonkers for huge list of demands - as it comes with no payA bonkers job ad with a huge list of demands has been blasted online as the would-be employer offers no pay but the promise of earning five figures in the near futureThe advert has been labelled bonkers after it was shared online Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A aposbonkersapos job ad with a huge list of demands has been blasted online as it comes with aposno payapos. The advert for an executive assistant has been posted on Craigslist and it asks a lot from applicants and reads more like a dating profile than job vacancy.According to the advert, the successful applicant will be female, around , and should look forward to a relationship similar to that of Pepper Pots and Tony Stark in Iron Man. In the description, it says that currently there is no pay, but the job has the potential to pay over £, in the next five years -the company doesnapost fold. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. The description states that the new employee will keep their boss aposon taskapos with his to-do list, as well as cooking all meals, tidying his house, and driving him everywhere. The advert, shared on Reddit, reads: Currently, there is no pay, although every new contract my company lands you will earn a commission and the more useful you become and the more time you save me, theoretically I should make more money. So the more time and money you save me, the more money you will make. They need to be female. I am , I would prefer around my age asthey are too old then they will retire before me and this is a lelong commitment for both me and the assistant I choose.  For inspiration or understanding of what the job would be like, please imagine yourself as Pepper Pots and I am Tony Stark. You need to be cute, positive, fun, got to be cool with green since I blaze all the time, which means you will as well. I am very unorthodox and eccentric. Please reach out to me via text, this is  and email is so last gen. Text me your name, a picture of you, we will set up a phone call and then proceed from there. Potentially you could end up making ,+ in five years and more after that. Money and dealing with my crazy ass aside, it would be an adventure. Text me, letaposs chat. The advert for the unusual job, which is based in Los Angeles, has been roasted after a screenshot was shared on Reddit. One user said: Stark raving bonkers. Then another wrote: Geez...who is going to turn down the job of being this guyaposs live-in maid for free  And a third added: Entrepreneur culture is a hell of a drug. Man thinks heaposs Steve Jobs and will be broke and in debt in five years. Itaposs sad. title: man gets back jerk manager
story: Man gets his own back on jerk manager after spotting red flags during job interviewA man was excited to interview for an attractive job opportunity, but claims the employer lied about the wage and was deliberately late to test him - so he got his own backA man got revenge on a nightmare employer after spotting several red flagsImage: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments A man was offended by a potential employeraposs behaviour during an interview - so he decided to get revenge. Sharing his story anonymously, the man said that he was excited to interview for the position as it was in his chosen field and paid pretty well.But during the interview, the employer was deliberately late to test the manaposs patience and had lied about the wage to guarantee a lot of interviewees. The man was shocked by these aposred flagapos behaviours but accepted the job anyway - just so he could not turn up on his first day to teach the employer a lesson. What do you think about the employeraposs behaviour  Let us know in the comments... Taking to Reddit, the man said the had driven for over an hour to get to the interview, but thought it was worth it as the job paid £ an hour.But when he arrived the employer was nowhere to be seen, and the receptionist kept saying he was just around the corner. He said: One hour later Iaposm p****d and I asked the secretary, aposhey is the interview going to happenapos  She said that the manager just text her and he is ten minutes away. I should have just left but my greed kept me there.  One hour after that the manager strolled in and told me Iaposm late to interviews on purpose so I can find patient people. I tried to stay professional and I do pretty well in the interview. He wanted to hire me on the spot but I always ask about benefits and pay before I say yes. He said with the biggest smile it pays £ a day. I was so confused. I let him know that career services said £ an hour. He said plainly that he always tells them that so he can have the most techs come in and interview. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. He starts complaining how no one wants to work anymore and itaposs so hard to find people. I was so p****d that I told him I would take the job. He told me to start Monday. Iaposm not going to go. I just hope he gets pissed off and tries to call me asking why I didnapost show. Iaposm planning on saying aposI just donapost want to work no moreapos. After sharing his story online, other Reddit users blasted the employer for his deceitful tactics. One said: I have a better idea. Keep your phone nearby and text him aposalmost thereapos every hour. Make him wait like he made you wait. Then when he realises you’re not coming, say aposI like making my employer wait to seethey’re patientapos. Then a second wrote: £ a day  So your workday is . hours  Odd. And another commented: £ hr lmao. Less than half of whataposs advertised. Thereaposs no way this has ever worked for him Glad you saw what a jerk he is, added a fourth user. title: mans baffling relationship advice struggling
story: Mans baffling relationship advice for struggling couples leaves people idedThe man said he changed his approach with his partner after she complained that he wasnt showing her enough attention - and claims it has done wonders for their sex leHe treats her like his dog but without the baby voice Image: Getty ImagesByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Feb |commentsNo matter how strong a relationship is, youaposre bound to experience a few rough patches along the way. Big or small - whereaposs important is that each partner takes them seriously and addresses whataposs going on. But one man left people rather ided after he explained how he rekindled the spark with his girlfriend after she complained he wasnapost very attentive.Writing on Reddit, he explained that he decided to treat his girlfriend like his dog - and claims theyaposre much happier as a consequence.Sharing his baffling relationship advice, the man said his girlfriend had sat him down and told him she needed to feel loved and appreciated. So in a bid to show her more attention, he turned to the other love of his le...his dog. He explained: I rarely show emotion. I’m very reserved and level headed so my emotions, whether positive or negative, rarely spike too much.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.  She knows I don’t wear my emotions, and that generally includes her even though she knows I love her. I’m not handsy, I kiss her when appropriate, and let her know I love her when appropriate. Trying to appease his girlfriend, the man started to treat her like his dog, who he always provides with his unided attention. I love my dog more than anything or anyone. She gets more le and emotion out of me than anyone, he added. Since their heart-to-heart, the man has been getting kissy and playful with his girlfriend, mimicking how he treats his beloved dog. He has also been surprising her with treats such as chocolates and little gts that he spots when out shopping. He said: I’ve been thinking of my affection for her like I do my dog. I get super excited to see her like my dog does when I get home.  My dog constantly wants scratches so I always rub her shoulders or play with her hair or have my hand on her thigh. My dog loves when I give her a new toy or treat so I have little gts and snacks to give to her when the mood strikes. Amazed by the dference it has made, the man claims his unconventional approach to his relationship has also improved the coupleaposs sex le. My girlfriend loves it, and it’s easy for me because I literally just treat her like my dog, but without the baby voice, he said. It’s renewed our passion and she is so, so happy and can’t understand how I turned my emotions around so easily. Sharing his advice to couples struggling with intimacy, he added: I just do the things to her that I do to my dog because I love my dog more. While some users said he should have kept this comparison to himself, others quickly shared their own experiences with treating their partners like their pets. One user said: If my husband kept askingI wanted to get snacks, Iaposd be pretty happy to be honest. Fat, but happy. Another added: My boyfriend actually openly tells me that my dog and I are like the same. We both love belly rubs and demand for affection. I am not insulted though, as long as he gives me my belly rubs. A third said: I showed my boyfriend this and now he keeps going aposWanna get snacks apos and aposNeed to go potty apos. news weird-news woman-leaves-people-stitches-over-"TikToker leaves fans in hysterics over chicken feet inkByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments When it comes to getting a tattoo, researching your artist is paramount - especially as dferent tattoo designs will require artists with dferent specialities to properly achieve the look you want. And one woman on TikTok has learned that lesson the hard way after she went to an artist specialising in tribal tattoos for her small and minimalistic design, and was left regretting her decision.Abigail Brady, who is from the US, shared a video in which she showed off the three small birds she wanted inked on her wrist, which were simple black silhouettes with wing and tail details.But instead, Abby received less defined black splodges - which some have compared tochicken footprints .Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.The woman, who posts under the username @abigailkbrady, wrote in her video: Got a tattoo... and it definitely didnapost turn out [how I expected].She also wrote in the clipaposs caption: In the tattoo artists defence, he she specialises in tribal tattoos and not mini tattoos. And commenters were left in stitches by the womanaposs less than ideal inking. One said: It looks like chicken footprints. Oh gosh, noooo, another sympathetic commenter wrote.But Abby is taking the tattoo blunder in her stride, as she replied one comment agreeing that her ink does look like chicken feet, while also telling several others that she plans on having it removed or covered up. She said: Iaposm thinking about getting it removed or covered and starting over, but I donapost know. Abby definitely isnapost the only one of us to have received a bad tattoo, as several others have recently shared their experiences with disastrous inkings online.Earlier this week, we shared how Brittany Lewin was in love with her stylish pineapple tattoo - until she discovered the secret meaning behind the fruit.As it turns out, upside-down pineapples are apparently a secret sign used by swingers to identy those on the lookout for a swinger party - while a pineapple placed on the porch or mailbox of a house also signies a swinger party is currently going on inside. Swingers also reportedly identy each other in public by opting for clothes that feature the tangy tropical fruit. Brittany posted a video on TikTok with the caption: When you realise youaposve made a mistake.The woman also shared screenshots of the messages she exchanged with her friend, who initially asked herher tattoo was of an upside-down pineapple - before hinting that she might want to Google the truth.Check out Abigailaposs website hereDo you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TattoosViralUmm what " data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: british hostage handcuffed apple store
story: British hostage handcuffed in Apple store flees before captor run over by policeA British man, , underwent the horrying ordeal in Amsterdam on Tuesday evening, lasting five hours, with around  armed police swarming the scene in a bid to save himA hostage-taker puts his arm around the neck of a hostage during a robbery at the Apple Store on Leidseplein in Amsterdam on February  Image: ANP AFP via Getty ImagesByAdam May:,  Feb A British hostage who was handcuffed in an Apple store managed to heroically escape, leading his captor outside before police ran him over. The -year-old Brit found himself handcuffed with his hands behind his back while a gunman pointed a firearm towards him. The horrying ordeal happened in Amsterdam on Tuesday evening and a widely shared clip showed the terried hostage caught in a headlock with what looked like a gun pointed to his head inside the store. The hostage-taker was seen putting his arm around the hostage as they both looked at Apple products in the shop. After managing to bravely escape the gunman, the hostage was chased down the street before the captor was hit by a police car in Leidseplein - a square within the Dutch capital.  He was then seen lying on the street while a robot checked him for explosives. Another video clip from the scene showed around  armed police and specialist units swarming the street and taking cover. The incident started at around .pm, with the stand-off lasting nearly five hours. aposDozensapos of hostages were involved, the Daily Mail reports and most left the building by .pm, although itaposs understood some were allowed to leave slightly earlier. The incident was declared over by officers at around pm. “We can confirm that the hostage-taker is out of the Apple Store,” police said in a tweet last night.  “He is lying on the street and a robot is checking him for explosives. Armed police officers have him under control from a distance. The hostage is safe. Amsterdam police added: We managed to stop the hostage-taker by hitting him as he ran out. Violent images of that collision can be seen. We now know that the suspect had no explosives on his body and medical personnel are now taking care of him. One witness claimed they had to aposrun for their leapos after hearing gunshots, telling Dutch broadcaster AT: I was standing on the zebra crossing opposite the apple store. An employee walked out in panic with a walkie-talkie, yelling.  At that moment the penny hadnapost dropped yet and I was about to cross the zebra crossing opposite the entrance to the Apple store. And thataposs when I heard gunshots inside. According to the Associated Press, local Dutch broadcaster AT suggested the standoff was the result of an attempted armed robbery, although the motive wasnapost immediately clear. During the incident, members of the public were urged to stay away while officers dealt with the situation. Amsterdam police confirmed the suspected hostage-taker, , is an Amsterdam resident and is now in custody. news world-news holidays-back-brits-australia-greece-"Spain, France, Denmark, Norway and Australias travel rulesByKate Lally:,  Feb |commentsBritish tourists and those with loved ones abroad can now jet to other countries with far fewer restrictions than before.Now two years into the Covid- pandemic, many countries are beginning to relax border measures designed to keep the infectious disease at bay.This week thousands of Australians flooded back into the country for the first time since , turning airports into scenes of high emotion. The Land Down Under implemented some of the strictest pandemic measures of any democracy back in March .It is the latest in a list of nations that have relaxed their coronavirus rules. Here are some of the countries that have recently changed their travel regulations, as collated by Liverpool Echo.  Australia As of February , , arrivals who are fully vaccinated will not need a travel exemption and will not be made to quarantine. Anyone entering the country is also required to complete an Australia Travel Declaration at least  hours before departure. The ATD includes a declaration regarding your vaccination status and you will be asked to upload your vaccination certicate. Unvaccinated visa holders will still need a valid travel exemption to enter Australia - and these will not be granted solely for tourism purposes.Inbound passengers must also provide a negative accepted Covid- test result.Australian states and territories also have their own Covid- rules, with the strictest enforced by Western Australia state which covers a third of the island continent.  Spain Spain introduced a huge change for holidaymakers this week as children over  from non-EU countries, such as the UK, now do not need to be fully vaccinated against coronavirus to enter the country. The change came into force on Monday, February , ahead of the school half term. Adults who are fully vaccinated and travelling from the UK can enter Spain without needing to test or quarantine regardless of your reason for travel. The country also has new booster jab requirements which mean thatyou completed your vaccination course over nine months ago, youaposll need a booster jab to be considered fully vaccinated. However, adult Brits yet to receive both jabs can only enter the countrytheir reason for travel falls into one of the categories listed as essential. Morocco  After swtly closing its borders in October, Morocco is now welcoming fully vaccinated tourists again. Passengers must also present a negative PCR result, and download, print and sign a passenger health form before arrival in Morocco. Children under the age of  are exempt from the pre-travel PCR test requirement, and children under the age of  are exempt from the requirement to present a vaccine pass. France Only fully vaccinated Brits can visit for holidays without needing to quarantine. The country has scrapped Covid test requirements so fully vaccinated holidaymakers wonapost need a PCR or antigen test to visit.Unvaccinated travellers need an essential reason to visit. There are also new booster jab requirementsyou were vaccinated over  days ago. All passengers will also need to sign a apossworn statementapos confirming they are not showing symptoms of coronavirus, nor have they been in contact with a confirmed case within  days before travel to France.  Norway Norway’s border is now open as it was before the pandemic began. Most restrictions within the country have also been lted. All travellers arriving in Norway must complete registration prior to arrival. This also applies to Norwegian citizens. Arrivals must also take a test upon entering the country, regardless of their vaccination status. . Greece Greece is open to both vaccinated and unvaccinated Brits. Greece recently updated its rules so that fully vaccinated travellers will be exempt from Covid test requirements. Anyone over the age of  will need to fill out a pre-departure passenger locator form. If youaposre unvaccinated or partially vaccinated, you will need to show proof of a negative Covid test result. PCR tests can be taken within  hours of arrival, or antigen tests within  hours of arrival. Israel Israel will now allow unvaccinated tourists to enter from the beginning of next month. Its government announced the rule change on Sunday as the latest wave of the coronavirus recedes. Prime Minister Naftali Bennett said that foreign tourists, both vaccinated and unvaccinated, would be required to take PCR coronavirus tests before their flights and upon landing. The rules go into effect on March . title: meet glamorous danish princess whos
story: Meet the glamorous Danish Princess whos been dubbed Denmarks Kate MiddletonToday, Kate Middleton met with Denmarks Crown Princess Mary during her visit to Denmark - and their similar stories of how they became royals has led to many comparisonsKate Middleton with Crown Princess Mary of Denmark at Royal Ascot in  Image: Getty ImagesByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsThey are often dubbed the worldaposs most stylish royals thanks to their enviable wardrobes.And today fans of royal fashion were in for a treat as the Duchess of Cambridge met with Denmarkaposs Crown Princess Mary in Copenhagen. Kate enjoyed an audience with Mary and her mother-in-law Queen Margrethe before they had lunch together.After they visited a crisis shelter together that helps women and children who have been exposed to domestic violence. And itaposs not just their fashion choices that are similar - both Kate and Mary have had similar royal careers going from commoners to future Queen consorts... Early years  Like Kate, Mary enjoyed a fairly normal childhood and was born Mary Elizabeth Donaldson in Hobart in Tasmania, Australia to Scottish parents. She attended the University of Hobart and after graduating in , she worked as an advertising executive in Melbourne, before moving to Edinburgh then Sydney, where she worked for an international firm. Royal romance Her first brush with royalty came in  when she met her future husband Prince Frederik of Denmark in a bar in Sydney during the Olympic Games. Mary didn’t recognise the handsome stranger who introduced himself as “Fred” and she gave him her phone number. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .He later recalled feeling she was his “soulmate” from that first encounter. When news of their long-distance romance broke, Mary moved to Copenhagen and got a job at Microsoft.They wed in  in a grand ceremony similar to that of Prince William and Kateaposs with Frederik declaring, “Mary is mine and I am hers.”Like Kate, Mary is a proud mum and has two sons and two daughters - Prince Christian, Princess Isabella, Prince Vincent and Princess Josephine. Important issuesBoth Kate and Mary have been involved in causes that help young children and women. In , Mary set up her own royal foundation that helps to improve the lives of vulnerable youngsters. Royal expert Ingrid Seward told the Mirror: They both have an interest in early childhood development and hope to unite their shared expertise. Both Catherine and Mary are experienced and Denmark is a world leader in this field. Future Queens However, one of their biggest similarities is that their future roles will both see them as Queen Consorts of their respective countries. Mary will become Queen of Denmark when her husband Frederik ascends to the throne after his mother Margrethe.  In an interview with the Financial Times for her th birthday, Mary once mused about what it means to be a modern royal.She said: It’s being in touch and being close to the people: knowing what’s happening in society which way are we heading what are the new trends and challenges. It’s a natural, organic process that happens as generations come and go.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgeMary, Crown Princess of DenmarkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: meet russian oligarchs under uk
story: Meet the Russian Oligarchs under UK sanctions: Putins billionaire alliesThree Russian oligarchs have so far been sanctioned by the UK government in response to Vladimir Putins actions in Ukraine. Five banks have also been sanctioned as the UK targets Russian assetsThree oligarchs have been sanctioned by the UK Image: Mikhail Tereshchenko TASSByBenjamin LynchTrends Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments In response to Vladimir Putin sending apospeacekeepingapos troops into Ukrainian territory, the UK imposed sanctions upon three Russian billionaires and five banks.The current sanctions are designed to hit Gennady Timchenko, Boris Rotenberg and his nephew Igor Rotenberg, who are said to be very close to the Putin regime, according to Boris Johnson.Further controversy arose when Labour MP Margaret Hodge questioned why Cha FC owner Roman Abramovich had not been sanctioned.Boris Johnson misspoke when claiming in the House of Commons that Abramovich had already been sanctioned.Labour MP Ben Bradshaw said: The three oligarchs he’s sanctioned today have been sanctioned by the US for four years. We need to do better than that. So who are the three oligarchs  Who is Gennady Timchenko  -year-old Gennady Timchenko is reportedly worth £. billion, according to Forbes.His private investment group, Volga, specialises in energy investments, among other opportunities and his net worth makes him the th richest person in the world. He has faced US sanctions since  due to his reportedly close ties with Putin. He is also major shareholder in Rossiya, which supported the destabilisation of Ukraine after the annexation of Crimea in , according to the government.  Rossiya is also one of the five banks sanctioned by the UK. He reportedly once told a Russian news agency: You have to pay for everything in your le. Even for your friendship with the president. The government has imposed travel bans and frozen the assets of each billionaire listed in its first wave of sanctions.Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said: [This] will hit oligarchs and banks close to the Kremlin. It sends a clear message that the UK will use our economic heft to inflict pain on Russia and degrade their strategic interests.Who is Boris Rotenberg   Boris and Igor Rotenberg have both been sanctioned by the UK as the uncle and nephew respectively have reportedly got extremely close ties to Putinaposs regime. Forbes estimates that Borisapos net worth is around £ million thanks to his association with SMP bank, co-owned with brother Arkady, Igoraposs father. Both Arkady and Boris, , were also hit by the sanctions Bradshaw referred to in the Commons, imposed by the US in . The US treasury has claimed that Boris and Igor were awarded billions worth of contracts with Gazprom ahead of the Sochi Olympics in .  Borisapos association with Putin seems to be notably close, with the two knowing each other since childhood and regularly playing ice hockey together. Who is Igor Rotenberg   At , Igor is the eldest son of Arkady Rotenberg with a fortune believed to be around £ million Itaposs thought that his wealth derives mainly from his role with his control of Gazprom Drilling, sold to him by Arkady.The businessman, also chairman of the board at National Telematic Systems, told Reuters at the time: Of course my father gave me a good start in business.Today I am an independent businessman and I am developing my assets with my team in a competitive, market environment.  Of the current sanctions, Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said further measures are readyRussia invades any more of Ukrainian territoryTruss said that while these sanctions are ready to be imposed, the government would stop short of giving back any money given by Russian-linked donors to the Conservative Party.She said: All of the donations to the Conservative Party are from people on the electoral register in Britain, those donations are properly declared. title: terrifying moment camper awakes find
story: Terrying moment camper awakes to find nest of CROCODILES invading his tentThe camper, a TikTok user from Brazil dubbed @eageltrinadade, was praised by followers for remaining so calm during the terrying close shave with the group of crocodilesA camper awoke to find a group of crocodiles trying to invade his tentByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Feb |comments A man on a camping trip awoke to find a nest of crocodiles trying to enter his tent.In a terrying clip, the killing machines can be seen prowling at the entrance of the camperaposs tent in the middle of the night.In the footage, posted by Brazilian TikTok user @eageltrinadade, he jokes about the close shave with his .million followers.Captioning the clip, he quipped: “For those who asked how the camp was.” Following up on the narrow escape, he released a second video showing the tent, flattened by the rampaging beasts. A light is then shined, lighting up the creaturesapos rocky hides as they wait outside. “The camp didn’t work out very well. To clear up doubts,” he captioned the clip. Many of his .million followers were baffled as to how the group of campers escaped, having been so close to the apex predators. Others were impressed at how the group maintained their composure during the croc invasion. One user confessed to being scared just by watching the footage.The clip comes after a British teen who was attacked by a croc on her gap year in Africa relived the terrying moment she was dragged under water and forced to fight for her le.Amelie Osborn-Smith, , was white water rafting along the Zambezi River at Victoria Falls when she was trapped in a death roll by a ft croc in November.The backpacker, from Andover, Hampshire, described the moment she felt something near her legs as she swam backwards towards the raft.She told how she initially thought it was her friend but then realised he was in line with her head and not her legs and then spotted the croc in the water.Speaking to Sky News, she said: I looked down and I saw the tail of it go over my legs because it was obviously measuring me up before it attacked me. Amelie said she couldnapost breathe after the reptile grabbed her right leg and immediately pulled her under water.But her friend, who was also in the water, managed to grab onto the shoulders of her le jacket while she kicked the beast. You just think how do I get out  How do we escape this  At that point, I was just so ridiculously grateful that my friend was in the water, she said. news world-news vladimir-putins-childhood-explained-miracle-"A look back at  years of Vladimir Putin from ByEmily RetterSenior Feature Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments The first time Vladimir Putin waged war it was against the rats which infested the corridors of his bleak boyhood home in a dilapidated Soviet apartment block.Telling the story of those vermin now, he makes clear he won his battles against them, possibly using the story to illustrate how he overcame post-war devastation and poverty to succeed. In First Person: An Astonishingly Frank Self-Portrait, published in , he writes: “There were hordes of rats in the front entryway. My friends and I used to chase them around with sticks. ”Once I spotted a huge rat and pursued it down the hall until I drove it into a corner. It had nowhere to run. Suddenly it lashed around and threw itself at me. I was surprised and frightened. Now the rat was chasing me.“Luckily, I was a little faster and I managed to slam the door shut in its nose. There, on that stair landing, I got a quick and lasting lesson in the meaning of the word cornered.” The anecdote may be part of his carefully curated narrative, but it gives us a glimpse into the making of the man who now has the world holding its breath. Putin was born on October , , in Leningrad, now St Petersburg, a city that had been under siege for  days in the Second World War. More than a million people had died of starvation, many families entirely wiped out. In the war, Putin’s father, Vladimir, was away fighting, while his mother, Maria, almost starved to death. Putin writes: “Once my mother fainted from hunger. People thought she had died, and they laid her out with the corpses. Luckily Mama woke up in time and started moaning.” His father was one of only four of the  men in his unit to come home from the war, and for the rest of his le limped because of shrapnel injuries.The couple are believed to have lost their two older children, one to diphtheria during the war, the second from another childhood illness. Vladimir Putin was a “miracle baby” who arrived late. His communal home was dire, shared with two other families. His former school teacher Vera Dmitrievna Gurevich said: “There was no hot water, no bathtub. The toilet was horrendous. And it was so cold, awful.” Putin was a street kid, small for his age and bullied so he had to toughen up fast. Masha Gessen, author of The Man Without A Face: The Unlikely Rise Of Vladimir Putin, says: “Putin’s parents worked pretty much around the clock, his mother ious unskilled jobs, his father at a factory. He was left to his own devices. He hung out in the courtyard with other boys, like all children did.  “And he was often picked upon and bullied until he started studying Sambo, a version of martial arts, and then later switched to Judo so he could compete.” He is now a black belt and likes the world to know it, some even referring to his inner circle as a “Judocracy”. Putin reflected in : “ years ago the Leningrad street taught me a rule:a fight is inevitable you have to throw the first punch.” Masha says: “He’s scrappy, very ambitious, very, very greedy.”She says Putin’s doting parents fed that greed. He had a wristwatch as a teen – something his dad didn’t have. When they won a car they reportedly gave it to their student son. Masha suggests by treating him as their “king”, Putin’s parents gave him a sense of entitlement. She said: “There’s a lot of proof he feels he is chosen now.” The proof could include his sprawling “Putin’s Palace” home, and those photos of him riding horses bare-chested. More recently, making French President Emmanuel Macron sit at the other end of a ridiculously long table says everything about his need to feel superior. According to the Kremlin website, Putin wanted to work in intelligence “even before he finished school”, and volunteered at . He holds a law degree from Leningrad State University plus a doctorate in economics, and was picked from  or more students for the KGB.  Pavel Koshelev, a college classmate and fellow KGB officer, said: “His most outstanding trait, I would say, was his fighting spirit and his strong will to achieve his goals.’’ In the late s, Putin was posted to Dresden, East Germany, reportedly to work in counter-espionage. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, he rose to become head of the KGB’s successor, the FSB, and then Boris Yeltsin’s successor when he resigned in . Putin said his KGB career prepared him for presidency. That discipline is still clear today as he works  and -hour days, something which took its toll on his family le. He married Lyudmila Putina, a former air hostess, in the mid-s and doted on their two daughters. After he and Lyudmila orced in , she reportedly said: “Our marriage is over due to the fact that we barely see each other. Vladimir is completely submerged in his work.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Boris JohnsonEmmanuel MacronBoris YeltsinVladimir PutinUEFA Champions League FinalWorld War Petrol pricesBullyingPoliticsDaily Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from The Courier and the Evening .Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week.
